H0.text: A puddle disappearing on a hot summer afternoon is an example of water condensing.

H1.text: Sweat forming on your forehead after you do a lot of exercise is an example of water condensing.

H2.text: Ice cubes melting when you put them out in the sun is an example of water condensing.

H3.text: Dew forming on plants during a cold night is an example of water condensing.

A4.text: When surface temperature drops, eventually reaching the dew point, atmospheric water vapor condenses to form droplets on the surface.

A5.text: When the exposed surface cools by radiating its heat, atmospheric moisture condenses at a rate greater than that at which it can evaporate, resulting in the formation of water droplets.
